page.title: 11Huddersfield Narrow Canal
page.content: In the canal there are stones and rubbish.It is very shallow and full of reeds and boats cannot get through. However, restoration work is being carried out by the Huddersfield Canal Society which will enable boats to use the canal again.An old swing bridge crosses the canal. It has two metal plates where the wood has rotted and the winding gear which opened the bridge has gone rusty. There is an aquaduct over the River Colne where the canal narrows. Further down stream is a lock which has been filled in and grassed over to stop people falling in.There is still a way for the water to get through. At the lower end of Milnsbridge there is a wharf.You can still see a couple of iron rings where the boats were moored. There are two road bridges over the canal in Milnsbridge.
